key_phrases: who get the grants vs the people who don’t, and why that is
more scrutiny / guidelines on how the money is spent on the backend
clearer communication as to who is getting what money and why
less money per person, given to more people
city becomes involved as a collaborator
large, rotating pool of advisors who are full time creative workers
serve the city with insights 'from the ground floor'
barriers_identified: lack of transparency in grant decisions
solutions_proposed: implement clearer communication on grant allocation
increase scrutiny and guidelines on fund usage
reduce grant amounts per recipient to reach more people
require city collaboration for large grants
create a rotating pool of creative worker advisors who are ineligible for grants while serving
